results.title: Roxanne
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Michael Rachmil, Daniel Melnick and Fred Schepisi
results.brief_description: A modern version of the Cyranno De Bergerac story starring Steve Martin and Daryl Hannah, directed by Fred Schepisi. Small town fire chief C.D. Bales falls in love with a new arrival to the town; an astronomer called Roxanne. He possesses a large nose which stands in the way of his attaining happiness, but eventually true love triumphs in this heartwarming tale.

results.title: Rowing: a symphony of motion
results.creator_credit: Docufilms, Trin Yarborough and Jerry Murphy
results.brief_description: Surveys the different varieties of rowing from the grace and solitude of the single oarsman to the drive and precision of an eight-oar crew - a parallel of fragile beauty and driving power. Also includes a segment on women in rowing.
results.description: Surveys the different varieties of rowing from the grace and solitude of the single oarsman to the drive and precision of an eight-oar crew - a parallel of fragile beauty and driving power. Also includes a segment on women in rowing.

results.title: Rowing on the Yarra
results.brief_description: A beautifully photographed portrait of Melbourne’s busy Yarra River during the rowing season with the Hoddle Bridge and passing automobile traffic framing the background using timelapse cinematography. A nostalgic feel to the film is conveyed through the use of tinted monochrome colouring and a music soundtrack.

results.title: Rowing for beginners
results.brief_description: The fundamentals of rowing are described and illustrated, often in slow motion. Tub pairs and eights from Magdalen College, Oxford University, at different stages of rowing experience, are photographed in action. Their good points and their faults are indicated.

results.title: Routes du soleil
results.creator_credit: French Tourist Office and Max Sautet
results.brief_description: Presents a colorful tour of Provence in the South of France, by two tourists, complete with camera and pet duck. Shows both the historical and contemporary scene, accompanied by appropriate music and commentary with well-timed humour enlivening the beautiful scenery.

results.title: Route des Cimes
results.brief_description: A road tanker’s daily hazardous climb up the snowbound mountainside to the village of Val d’Isere whose hotels, hospitals and homes are dependent upon its cargo for fuel. Contrasting with the upward grind of the tanker are exhilarating scenes of skiers skimming down from the slopes above Val d’Isere, breaking a new trail from the mountain tops to the village.

results.title: Roustabout
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Hal B Wallis and John Rich
results.brief_description: The year is 1964, and the mini-skirt is in. Charlie Rogers is a coffee-house singer who joins a financially troubled carnival. He is hired by owner, Maggie Morgan, and soon catches the eye of his pretty female co-worker, Cathy Lean. Cathy’s irate father, Joe, clashes with Charlie when he tries to romance his daughter, but Charlie’s singing and looks helps bring in the much-needed money for the near-bankrupt carnival. Cast includes Elvis Presley, Barbara Stanwyck, Joan Freeman and Leif Erickson.

results.title: Roundabout
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Leah Miller and Pieter Van Deusen
results.brief_description: Presents a story about a young boy’s experience with an old man who owns a magical toy merry-go-round and tells what happens when it is stolen by the boy’s friends. Designed to stimulate discussion about responsibility and consideration for others. Suitable for lower primary level.
